org.vngx.jsch.util

Class HostKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.util.HostKey

  • public class HostKey
extends Object

    Host key implementation as outlined in the RFC4251 spec for SSH.

    Each server host SHOULD have a host key. Hosts MAY have multiple host keys using multiple different algorithms. Multiple hosts MAY share the same host key. If a host has keys at all, it MUST have at least one key that uses each REQUIRED public key algorithm (DSS[FIPS-186-2]).

    The server host key is used during key exchange to verify that the client is really talking to the correct server. For this to be possible, the client must have a prior knowledge of the server's public host key.

    http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4251.txt
    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

    • Constructor Detail

      • HostKey

        public HostKey(String host,
               byte[] key)
        throws JSchException
        Creates a new instance of HostKey for the specified host and key value. Attempts to determine key type from the key value; if it cannot be determined, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        host - name (or comma delimited list of hosts)
        key - data
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • HostKey

        public HostKey(String host,
               KeyType keyType,
               byte[] key)
        throws JSchException
        Creates a new instance of HostKey for the specified host and key value and of the specified type. If the specified key type is null, attempts to determine key type from key value. If the key type is unknown after guessing, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        host - name (or comma delimited list of hosts)
        keyType - of host key (null to guess key type)
        key - data
        Throws:
        JSchException - if key type cannot be determined

        public String getFingerPrint()
                      throws JSchException
        Returns a hashed fingerprint for this host key using the MD5 instance specified in the Jsch configuration.
        Returns:
        fingerprint hash
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • isMatched

        public boolean isMatched(String host)
        Returns true if the specified host matches this host key.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public int getHostCount()

        Returns:

      • removeHost

        protected boolean removeHost(String host)
        Removes a single host from the list of hosts which belong to this key. If the host key only has a single host which matches the specified host, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        host - to remove, if multiple hosts defined in key
        Returns:
        true if host was successfully removed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if host is the only host value

      • guessType

        protected static KeyType guessType(byte[] key)
        Attempts to determine the host key type by checking the value of the 9th bit of the key. If the type cannot be determined, then UNKNOWN is returned. Note: Assumes key type is only 'ssh-dss' or 'ssh-rsa'.
        Parameters:
        key - blob for host key
        Returns:
        host key type guessed from key value

      • createHostKey

        public static HostKey createHostKey(String host,
                                    byte[] key,
                                    boolean hashed)
                             throws JSchException
        Creates a new instance of HostKey for the specified host and key value. If hash is true, then the host value will be hashed accordingly.

        Please note this method does not add the newly created host key to the known hosts.

        Parameters:
        host -
        key -
        hashed - true to indicate host value should be hashed
        Returns:
        new HostKey instance
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur
